other_tests.findings: Metaplastic glandular mucosa with goblet cells consistent with Barrett’s esophagus, with high-grade dysplasia.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Persistent signs of Barrett’s esophagus with high-grade dysplasia four months later.

other_tests.findings: 5-cm-long segment with signs consistent with Barrett’s esophagus and a 1 cm polypoid lesion within the distal esophagus.
Intramucosal carcinoma arising in high-grade dysplasia; high-grade dysplasia extended to the lateral margin.
Moderately severe esophagitis within the treated segment.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial symptoms included nausea, odynophagia, and chest discomfort; four weeks later, stricture formation was noted and dilated.
No recurrence of Barrett’s esophagus or dysplasia at the most recent follow-up visit 46 months after treatment.
